info.description: Implementation of the basic standard token. https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-20 Originally based on code by FirstBlood: https://github.com/Firstbloodio/token/blob/master/smart_contract/FirstBloodToken.sol * This implementation emits additional Approval events, allowing applications to reconstruct the allowance status for all accounts just by listening to said events. Note that this isn't required by the specification, and other compliant implementations may not do it.
info.title: erc20

get.description: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

parameters.description: address: address The address which owns the funds.
parameters.name: owner

parameters.description: address: address The address which will spend the funds.
parameters.name: spender

200.description: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

post.description: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

200.description: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

get.description: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

parameters.description: address: The address which will spend the funds.
parameters.name: spender

parameters.description: uint256: The amount of tokens to be spent.
parameters.name: value

post.description: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

get.description: Gets the balance of the specified address.

parameters.description: address: The address to query the balance of.
parameters.name: owner

200.description: A uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

post.description: Gets the balance of the specified address.

200.description: A uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

get.description: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when _allowed[msg.sender][spender] == 0. To decrement allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

parameters.description: address: The address which will spend the funds.
parameters.name: spender

parameters.description: uint256: The amount of tokens to decrease the allowance by.
parameters.name: subtractedValue

post.description: Decrease the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when _allowed[msg.sender][spender] == 0. To decrement allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

get.description: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when _allowed[msg.sender][spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

parameters.description: address: The address which will spend the funds.
parameters.name: spender

parameters.description: uint256: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.
parameters.name: addedValue

post.description: Increase the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender. approve should be called when _allowed[msg.sender][spender] == 0. To increment allowed value is better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined) From MonolithDAO Token.sol Emits an Approval event.

get.description: Transfer tokens from one address to another. Note that while this function emits an Approval event, this is not required as per the specification, and other compliant implementations may not emit the event.

parameters.description: address: address The address which you want to send tokens from
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: address: address The address which you want to transfer to
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: uint256: uint256 the amount of tokens to be transferred
parameters.name: value

post.description: Transfer tokens from one address to another. Note that while this function emits an Approval event, this is not required as per the specification, and other compliant implementations may not emit the event.

spender.description: address: address The address which will spend the funds.

value.description: uint256: The amount of tokens to be spent.

addedValue.description: uint256: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.

spender.description: address: The address which will spend the funds.

from.description: address: address The address which you want to send tokens from

to.description: address: address The address which you want to transfer to

to.description: address: The address to transfer to.

value.description: uint256: The amount to be transferred.

blocknumberParam.description: The target block number for eth_call requests. One of 'earliest/latest/pending', a number or a hex string (header: x-firefly-blocknumber)
blocknumberParam.name: fly-blocknumber

callParam.description: Perform a read-only call with the same parameters that would be used to invoke, and return result (header: x-firefly-call)
callParam.name: fly-call

gasParam.description: Gas to send with the transaction (auto-calculated if not set) (header: x-firefly-gas)
gasParam.name: fly-gas

idParam.description: Optionally set the ID for this request - must be unique if set (header: x-firefly-id)
idParam.name: fly-id

privateForParam.description: Private transaction recipients (comma separated or multiple params) (header: x-firefly-privatefor)
privateForParam.name: fly-privatefor

registerParam.description: Register the installed contract on a friendly path (overwrites existing) (header: x-firefly-register)
registerParam.name: fly-register

syncParam.description: Block the HTTP request until the tx is mined (does not store the receipt) (header: x-firefly-sync)
syncParam.name: fly-sync

transactionParam.description: Query the details for the provided transaction hash (header: x-firefly-transaction)
transactionParam.name: fly-transaction

valueParam.description: Ether value to send with the transaction (header: x-firefly-ethvalue)
valueParam.name: fly-ethvalue
